item.title: XEP-XXXX: Message Scheduling
item.description: Abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension for schedule future sends. Authors: Kompowiec2 Copyright: © 1999 – 2025 XMPP Standards Foundation. SEE LEGAL NOTICES. Status Active Type: Standards Track Version 1.0.0 (2025-09-14) 1. Summary This XEP defines a standard mechanism for scheduling the delivery of XMPP messages at a specific future time or after a specified delay. It provides a client- and server-compatible protocol for scheduling one-off and recurring messages, support for time zones and absolute timestamps, status queries, cancellation, and policy controls for servers and components that choose to implement scheduling.

item.title: How to deal with trolling - the one question that breaks them: why it matters, for you?
item.description: Energy vampires, authoritarianism, trolls, propagandist and just other toxic people usually run on: Attention Validation Drama Control. I don't any of these, my goal is just peace.
